titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Economic Opportunity and Assets Program, Vice President, Office Files of Pablo Farias
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Economic Opportunity and Assets Program, Vice President, Office Files of Pablo Farias FA1358

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-05-01 01:01:50 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Economic Opportunity and Assets Program, Vice President, Office Files of Pablo Farias

physdesc.extent: 24 document boxes: 23 letter size and 1 legal size

did.langmaterial: English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is comprised of five series.
Original order was maintained as much as possible.
The collection arrangement is as follows:
Series 1. Leadership for a Changing World, 1995-2006
Series 5. Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) Unit files, 2005-2013

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.
This material was transferred to the RAC in two accessions in 2021 and 2022 and was ingested by the RAC as Accessions 2021:102 and 2022:055.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the office files of Pablo Farias who worked at the Ford Foundation for more than a decade, primarily in the Foundation's assets building programs. Farias served as Deputy Vice President and Vice President of the Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS) and then Vice President of the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) after an organizational restructuring at the Foundation. Prior to his work in the assets programs, Farias served as the Foundation's Representative for Mexico and Central America and was based in the Mexico City Office. The collection does not contain any files created from Farias' time as Representative for Mexico.

There are several different groupings of materials within the collection that are represented by different series. The first series pertains to the Leadership for a Changing World program, the second series contains files documenting meetings and trips, and the third series contains files documenting the administration of the Foundation's various field offices. The fourth series has been labeled general files because it contains a mix of meeting and trip files, programs strategy files, administrative files, and subject files. The last series contains a group of files that are specifically about the different program units of the EOA.

Within the collection, there are not clear divisions between materials Farias created when he worked in ASSETS and materials created when he worked in EOA. The collection also includes materials created before Farias started working in the Foundation's assets programs and materials created after he left the Foundation. The records created prior to Farias' tenure in ASSETS appear to have been created by Melvin Oliver, Farias' predecessor as Vice President of ASSETS, and the records created after Farias left the Foundation may have been created by his successor as EOA Vice President, Xavier de Souza Briggs. The collection is more like the office files of the Vice President for the Foundation's assets building programs, from ASSETS to EOA, than files specific to Farias' work.

The collection's contents show program interests and strategy history of the Foundation's assets building programs. These interests include sustainable economic development in consideration of environment and climate change concerns and financial asset building support for low-income communities and countries in the Global South. Files document the emphasis of HIV/AIDS, reproductive health, and sexuality in the Foundation's international programming. Relief and recovery for natural disasters was also a focus of the Foundation in the mid-2000s in response to the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami and Hurricane Katrina's impact on the Gulf Coast of the United States in 2005. Materials concerning program strategy discuss organizational learning, initiative evaluation, and lines of work statements.

Briefing books are one of the most prevalent types of materials found throughout the collection. These records document the subject matter, context, and scheduling of various meetings, site visits, and projects. Other common material formats found throughout the collection include correspondence, drafts, notes, reports, presentations, agendas, itineraries, articles, newsclips, publications, and Recommended Grant Action records (RGAs). There are also a few photographs and digital media items in the collection. The photographs document trips to different countries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

did.unittitle: Leadership for a Changing World

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains files concerning the Ford Foundation's Leadership for a Changing World Program (LCW). Ford managed the LCW in partnership with the Advocacy Institute and the Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service at New York University. LCW recognized and supported community leaders and promoted leadership development.
Files document proposals for the program, press coverage, awardees, and assessment of the program.

Meetings and trips files

physdesc.extent: 4.5 document boxes: 3.5 letter size and 1 legal size

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting and trip files Pablo Farias created when he served as Vice President of the Ford Foundation's Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS) and then Vice President of the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA). These meetings and trips include internal Ford Foundation meetings, grantee site visits, trips to Ford Foundation field offices, and meetings and conferences related to program interests.

Many of the field office visits and international trips documented in the series were organized for Farias and other senior Foundation staff like President Luis Ubinas. Several files in the series show the Foundation's support for community forestry as a route towards sustainable economic development while other meetings and trips show the focus of HIV/AIDS in the Foundation's international programming.

There are other files related to meetings and trips found throughout the rest of the collection, but the meeting and trips files in this series were specifically stored together. The collection arrangement thus reflects that.

Field Office administration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files in this series pertain to the administration and activities of various Ford Foundation field offices.

Administrative concerns documented within the files include office operations like staffing, policies, and office building matters. The series provides some insight into the history of the Ford Foundation's international offices structuring such as the transfer of Thailand programming to the Hanoi, Vietnam Office and the closing of the Manila, Philippines Office.

Files also show how the programming interests of the Foundation's assets programs were carried out in different regions of the world through the field offices. Such interests include sustainable development through community forestry and other natural resource conservation means in Asia, Africa, and Latin America, support for disaster recovery in response to the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami in South and Southeast Asia and Eastern Africa, and HIV/AIDS throughout various regions.
The last part of the series was separated from the rest of the files prior to transfer to the RAC. The intellectual relationship between the materials was reestablished during processing.

General files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains an assortment of different types of files created and maintained by Pablo Farias. These types of files include meeting and trip files, administrative files, subject files, and program strategy files. The different files were stored together, so it was decided during processing to keep them in the same series. As mentioned in the collection scope and content note, there are materials created before Farias started working in the Foundation's assets building programs and materials created after Farias left the Ford Foundation.

Like in the second series, meeting and trip files encompass internal Foundation meetings, grantee site visits, trips to Foundation field offices in countries outside the United States, and conferences and meetings related to assets programing interests. Several files concerning trips to Foundation field offices are more broadly focused and contain materials related to more than one visit as well as materials related to that office's program strategy and activities for its region. One file includes a large number of images captured during visits to China and India in 2005 and 2007.

A significant segment of the program strategy materials in the series concern initiative strategy, evaluation, and impact. These records show the Foundation's broader efforts to embed organizational learning. Many of these records were produced after Farias left the Foundation.

Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) Unit files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains files specifically concerning the work of the Ford Foundation's Economic Opportunity and Assets Program's (EOA) units. Pablo Farias whose office maintained these files served as Vice President of EOA. The units documented in the series are Quality Employment, Natural Resources and Sustainable Development, Financial Assets, and Metropolitan Opportunity. Helen Neuborne served as Director of Quality Employment, David Kaimowitz served as Director of Natural Resources and Sustainable Development, Frank DeGiovanni served as Director of Financial Assets, and George McCarthy served as Director of Metropolitan Opportunity.

Materials in the series document the different program interests of the EOA units. Quality Employment focused on workers' conditions and benefits, Natural Resources and Sustainable Development focused on economic development compatible with environment and climate change concerns, Financial Assets focused on building financial security, and Metropolitan Opportunity focused on economic development for urban communities.
The files document the units' interests through the records they hold pertaining to specific meetings (both internal unit meetings and unit organized and supported topic meetings) and projects.
There are other Ford Foundation collections containing files pertaining to the EOA unit activities.
